issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem is a duplicate of an existing issue.
resolution.name: Duplicate

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
We had this happen on the release cloud.

Wed Oct 24 00:26:12 2012 ERROR [Databases:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:bootstrap:Topology::external/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#24] [com.eucalyptus.bootstrap.Databases.isRunning(Databases.java):964] java.io.IOException: Cannot run program "/usr/pgsql-9.1/bin/pg_ctl": java.io.IOException: error=12, Cannot allocate memory
java.io.IOException: Cannot run program "/usr/pgsql-9.1/bin/pg_ctl": java.io.IOException: error=12, Cannot allocate memory

Restarting process to force re-synchronization.

fields.summary: httpd runs out of memory over time

Out of memory: Kill process 23941 (httpd) score 118 or sacrifice child
Killed process 23941, UID 498, (httpd) total-vm:2771552kB, anon-rss:874260kB, file-rss:2116kB
Identical to 3030. We a new AXIS2C-1.6.0-05 RPM available for testing that removes libxml2 from axis and uses Axiom standard xml parser.
Not a blocker for 3.2.  We'd need more time for 3.2 burn in with a dependency change in libxml2.
Neil mentioned he thought this was different than 3030.  Neil, can you provide more detail?

I linked them since they "relate" (that's all I put in the link type).  
I think we can test this shortly with a 3.2.1 w/the suggested fix in our production release cloud since its reproducible there.

Axis2c-1.0.6-05 has been created using the default Axiom xml parser instead of 
libxml2 2.6.7 that eliminates a memory leak in libxml2 that shows up in httpd .
